1.(a + b)² = (a + b)(a + b) = a² + 2ab + b²
2.(a - b)² = (a - b)(a - b) = a² + 2ab - b²
3.(a + b)(a - b) =a² b²
4.(a + b)= (a + b)(a + b)(a + b)= a³ + 3a²b + 3ab² + b
ohhhhh, idk what is going on
(a+b)^2 = (a+b)(a-b) not ( a+b) (a+b) thank me later

I'm not sure if you noticed but you made a big mistake in your notation, not that it would change your end answer, but it's contradictory non the less. You say in your notation that the sum of K=0 is to n, which is incorrect considering that any factored out binomial always has one more term then the number of times it's multiplied by itself, or one more then the value of n. So really the notation should be the sum of K=0 to n + 1. n and n are not the same, which you say at approx. 4:30

i like how you put everything out there in plain english even silly old me can do that. but im always thinking why all those pluses and just make the whole thing one small sum so everything is simplified and common that way you dont have to over think things.

Btw with the k- therium i think it could have been said that k was more of a number counter that allows the sum to progress and not be held in a single spot.

the whole k over number thing i dont really understand that part i find personally i would just kill the k and add it more of a off shot to the entire sum but still use it to say this is why the sum is actually traveling forward and adding up instead of one part of the sum staying in one spot trying to add on top of it self. if you did not put those plus elements out there it would have stood still if you catch what im saying ?.
